article.headline: Western Michigan 84, Central Michigan 39
article.story: KALAMAZOO, Mich. (AP) -- Joe Reitz scored a game-high 17 points, leading Western Michigan to an 84-39 victory over Central Michigan on Saturday. Four Western starters, plus reserve guard Stane's Bufford (15 points), reached double figures in scoring. The Broncos (14-5, 7-2 Mid-American) scored their most lopsided victory since a 48-point win over Lake Superior State in 1979. Jeff Bohnhoff scored eight points for Central (7-11, 2-8), which has lost seven of its last eight games. Central played without starting guard Kevin Nelson, the team's leading scorer, and guard/forward Sefton Barrett, who were suspended indefinitely before the game for breaking unspecified team rules. Rickey Willis scored 13 for Western, Levi Rost had 11 and Ben Reed, 10. Central, down 37-27 at halftime, scored just one basket in the first 15 minutes of the second half, missing 20-of-21 shots. Robert Sevalia, who scored seven in the first half, was shut out in the second half.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
